channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: FDA terminates emergency use authorization of hydroxychloroquine for Covid-19
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration has revoked its emergency use authorization for the drugs hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine for the treatment of Covid-19.

item.title: New Covid-19 cluster sends shock waves throughout China
WHO calls new cluster in Beijing 'significant'
CNN goes inside Seattle's autonomous zone amid protests
item.description: CNN's Dan Simon goes inside the six-block area of Seattle where protesters have set up a so-called autonomous zone.

item.title: Why the Donald Trump-West Point ramp story actually matters
CNN anchor on Fox News: You can't just quote Trump lying
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter compares the differences between what's happening on the ground in Seattle and how it's being covered by Fox News.

item.title: Black Lives Matter activist found dead, days after she was reported missing
Videos from police, the store and witnesses help piece together Rayshard Brooks' last moments alive
Inside the protester-occupied Seattle neighborhood
item.description: Barricades and street graffiti mark the entrance to what's known as Seattle's Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone, which protesters have occupied since last Monday.

item.title: New video from a witness shows Tulsa police arresting teens for 'jaywalking'
item.description: New video recorded by a Tulsa resident and obtained by CNN shows the arrest of two teens for "jaywalking" in a North Tulsa neighborhood on June 4.

item.title: Video shows police officers shoving a black protester to the ground
item.description: A video of peaceful protests in East Meadow, New York, shows Nassau County police officers shoving Terrel Tuosto to the ground and arresting him.

item.title: Three US aircraft carriers are patrolling the Pacific at the same time. And China's not happy
item.description: The deployment of three 100,000-ton US Navy aircraft carriers to the Pacific Ocean for the first time in years has drawn swift reaction from China, with state-sponsored media saying Beijing will not back down to defend its interests in the region.

item.title: Historic Supreme Court ruling protects LGBTQ workers from discrimination
What it's like to fly on Europe's biggest airline right now
item.description: European travelers have begun returning to the air as border restrictions ease, but the experience of a flight on the continent's biggest airline reveals just what's in store for those willing to fly in the wake of the pandemic.

item.title: Swiss women stage scream-in for equality and an end to domestic violence
item.description: Women across Switzerland took to the streets Sunday, screaming together for one minute as part of protests for gender equality.

item.title: Several Dallas Cowboys and Houston Texans players test positive for coronavirus
item.description: Several players for the Dallas Cowboys and Houston Texans have tested positive for the coronavirus, sources tell NFL Network's Ian Rapoport and Tom Pelissero.

item.title: Pilot's condition unknown after US Air Force fighter jet crashes
item.description: A US F-15 fighter jet crashed in the North Sea off England on Monday and the condition of its pilot is unknown, according to a statement from the 48th Fighter Wing.

item.title: Russia sentences ex-US marine to 16 years for espionage
item.description: Former US marine Paul Whelan was convicted of espionage and sentenced to 16 years in prison, a Moscow court ruled Monday.

item.title: Ben Carson urging Trump to rethink opposition to kneeling protests
item.description: Housing and Urban Development Secretary Dr. Ben Carson said Monday that he is urging President Donald Trump to reconsider his long-held opposition to athletes kneeling during the National Anthem, and Trump could be open to changing his mind.

item.title: Black man found hanging from a tree in Los Angeles County
item.description: Robert L. Fuller, a 24-year-old black man, was found hanging from a tree in northern Los Angeles County. Fire department personnel who responded to the scene determined he was dead, the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department said in a statement.

item.title: This could be the next major retailer facing bankruptcy
item.description: With more than 10 million men out of work and millions more working from home, perhaps indefinitely, this is not the best time to be selling men's dress clothes.

item.title: Ex-data official creates her own Covid-19 site that shows more cases than state reports
item.description: The data official behind Florida's Covid-19 dashboard says she has launched her own dashboard after being removed from the state's project.

item.title: Mom and children hike hundreds of miles to escape lockdown
item.description: Impoverished by the coronavirus pandemic, Maria and her three daughters - like hundreds of thousands of other Peruvians - were forced to hike hundreds of miles back to their hometown after leaving Peru's capital, Lima.

item.title: National gym chain files for bankruptcy and closes 100 locations
item.description: National gym chain 24 Hour Fitness has filed for bankruptcy, after the Covid-19 pandemic forced its facilities shut for months.

item.title: Bollywood star found dead in his Mumbai home
item.description: Indian actor Sushant Singh Rajput was found dead in his Mumbai residence on Sunday, according to a statement from Mumbai police. He was 34.

item.title: Former TIME Person of the Year found guilty of 'cyber libel' in blow to free press
item.description: Embattled Philippines journalist Maria Ressa was found guilty of "cyber libel" Monday, in a case she and press freedom groups have described as a politically motivated prosecution by the Duterte government.

item.title: Father arrested after two children die in hot truck in Oklahoma
item.description: Oklahoma father Dustin Dennis, 31, has been arrested and charged with two counts of second-degree murder after police say he left his two young children in a hot truck for five hours.​

item.title: Op-Ed: What speaking to my daughter about George Floyd taught me
item.description: CNN Supervising Producer Stephania Busari relays speaking to her daughter in Nigeria about George Floyd and race privilege.

item.title: BP warns of $17.5 billion hit as pandemic accelerates move away from oil
item.description: BP is writing down the value of its assets by as much as $17.5 billion as a shift away from fossil fuels is accelerated by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Hello Kitty founder, 92, handing business to his grandson
item.description: The 92-year-old who founded the company that created Hello Kitty is leaving after 60 years and handing control to his grandson.

item.title: Tapper: Trump is standing firm with 'dead, racist losers'
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper blasts President Donald Trump for refusing to rename US military bases named after Confederate leaders.

item.title: Amy Grant shares pictures of her heart surgery scar and talks about her 'miraculous' recovery
item.description: Gospel singer-songwriter Amy Grant has shared photos of her battle scar following her "miraculous" recovery from unexpected open heart surgery.

item.title: Spike Lee apologizes after appearing to defend Woody Allen
item.description: Spike Lee used Woody Allen to make a point about "cancel culture" and has now apologized following backlash over his remarks.

item.title: Dolly Parton statues instead of Confederate monuments is what some want
item.description: Confederate memorials in Tennessee should be replaced by statues of Dolly Parton, a new petition suggests.

item.title: See how these adorable giant anteaters made their zoo debut
item.description: The first artificially bred, giant anteater twins in Asia have made their public debut at Chimelong Safari Park in China.

item.title: 'The call that shattered my life,' popular Nigerian pastor mourns as wife dies suddenly at 39
item.description: A former beauty queen and wife of a popular Nigerian preacher has died prompting shock and sadness in the country.

item.title: Swiss authorities search for the person who left $191,000 of gold bars on a train
item.description: Swiss police are looking for a forgetful individual who left something rather important on a train -- a package full of gold bars, worth more than $190,000.

item.title: Serena coach doubts she'd play US Open without daughter
item.description: Serena Williams' decision of whether or not to play at the US Open -- if it is held -- may come down to family. It's yet another in the many personal crises facing sports stars amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Solar Orbiter makes its first close pass of the sun
item.description: The European Space Agency's Solar Orbiter made its first close pass of the sun on Monday, getting as close as 77 million kilometers (48 million miles) from the sun's surface.

item.title: SpongeBob Squarepants gay? Nickelodeon just reinforced that theory
item.description: There has long been debate about the sexuality of SpongeBob Squarepants and some are taking a Nickelodeon tweet as his coming out.

item.title: Beyoncé demands justice for Breonna Taylor
item.description: Music icon Beyoncé called on Kentucky's attorney general to bring about justice for Breonna Taylor and ultimately "demonstrate the value of a Black woman's life." HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: The airport left to rot
item.description: After months of shutdown, Athens International Airport is gearing up to "welcome the world" once again as Greece moves ahead with plans to gradually lift coronavirus restrictions in a bid to revive its key tourism industry.

item.title: Fury vs. Joshua concern: 'Organized crime figure' involved in securing showdown
item.description: The announcement of a potential world heavyweight bout between Tyson Fury and Anthony Joshua has raised questions about the role of Irishman Daniel Kinahan in helping secure the boxing deal.

item.title: 8 films to watch in a time of protest against systemic racism
item.description: Following the wave of demonstrations sparked by the killing of George Floyd, many of us have been thinking about the history of race in America, and the ongoing narrative of police violence. We are all looking for resources to help better understand the moment.

item.title: New Covid-19 cluster sends shock waves throughout China
Why a 2nd shutdown over Covid-19 might be worse than the 1st
item.description: It's an outcome no one wants, but could become a "harsh reality": a second wave of shutdowns.

item.title: Republicans urge Trump not to terminate relationship with WHO
item.description: Despite alleging that the World Health Organization "enabled" the Chinese government's sweeping cover-up of the coronavirus pandemic's origins, House Republicans are urging the Trump administration to reconsider its recent decision to terminate relations with the international body, arguing the US can do more to affect change as a member.

item.title: Why the Trump-West Point ramp story actually matters
item.description: • Trump defends cautious walk down ramp, which raised questions about his health

item.title: Why Trump's Supreme Court appointee Neil Gorsuch just protected LGBTQ rights
item.description: Justice Neil Gorsuch, President Donald Trump's first nominee to the Supreme Court, delivered an opinion Monday that will change how more than 7 million LGBTQ individuals will live and work in the United States.

item.title: Videos from police, the store and witnesses help piece together Rayshard Brooks' last moments alive
